FuncDef:
The ip path detection packet-format icmpv6 command enables connectivity detection and sets the packet type for connectivity detection to ICMPv6 Echo Request message.
The undo ip path detection packet-format icmpv6 command restores the default settings. The ip path detection packet-format icmpv6 command enables connectivity detection and sets the packet type for connectivity detection to ICMPv6 Echo Request message. The undo ip path detection packet-format icmpv6 command restores the default settings. By default, the connectivity detection function is disabled. This command is supported only on the CE6863H, CE6863H-K, CE6860-SAN, CE6866K, CE6866, CE6860-HAM, CE6855-48XS8CQ, CE6885-SAN, CE8850-SAN, CE8855, CE8851-32CQ4BQ, CE8851K, CE8851-32CQ8DQ-P, CE8850-HAM, CE6881H, CE6881H-K, CE6885, CE6885-T, CE6885-LL (standard forwarding mode) and CE6863E-48S8CQ.
CLIs: ip path detection packet-format icmpv6 src-ipv6 <srcip> dst-ipv6 <dstip>
undo ip path detection packet-format icmpv6 src-ipv6 <srcip> dst-ipv6 <dstip>

ParaDef.Info:
Sets the destination IPv6 address as the detection flag.
The value is a 32-digit hexadecimal number, in the format X:X:X:X:X:X:X:X.

Sets the source IPv6 address as the detection flag.
The value is a 32-digit hexadecimal number, in the format X:X:X:X:X:X:X:X.

Examples: [~HUAWEI] ip path detection packet-format icmpv6 src-ipv6 2001:db8:1::1 dst-ipv6 2001:db8:2::2
